t: A Maskil of David. When he was in the cave. A prayer.
I*pn cry aloud to the Lord;*s I*ln plead aloud to the Lord*s for mercy.
I*ln pour out my complaint before him; I*ln reveal my trouble to him.
Although*ln my spirit is weak within me, you*ln know my way. Along*ln this path I travel they*ln have hidden a trap for me.
Look*ln to the right and see: no*ln one stands up for me; there*ln is no refuge for me; no*ln one cares about me.
I*pn cry to you, Lord;*s I*ln say, “You are my shelter, my*ln portion in the land of the living.”
Listen*ln to my cry, for*ln I am very weak. Rescue*ln me from those who pursue me, for*ln they are too strong for me.
Free*ln me from prison so*ln that I can praise your name. The*ln righteous will gather around me because*ln you deal generously with me.
